title: The Gifted ones. - Rev. ed.
creator_contributor_role: National Film Board of Canada, production company
subject_group: Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Education of children
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Gifted children
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Education of children
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Education of children
description: The gifted child, whose advanced mind distinguishes him from others of his age, is a valuable asset to society. Some say gifted children should be taught in a class of their own. Others say that the average classroom is better for them. The film presents the views of two prominent educators: Dr Florence Dunlop, Ottawa, and Dr. T.W. Martin, Toronto.
